title: Creating a reading list on automatic simultaneous translation involves selecting articles that cover various aspects of the field, including foundational research, technological advancements, and practical applications. Here’s a list of 20 articles up to 2020 that you might find useful
**"Sequence to Sequence Learning with Neural Networks"** - Ilya Sutskever, Oriol Vinyals, Quoc V
This paper introduces the sequence-to-sequence model, which is foundational for many translation systems
**"Neural Machine Translation by Jointly Learning to Align and Translate"** - Dzmitry Bahdanau, Kyunghyun Cho, Yoshua Bengio
Discusses the attention mechanism, crucial for improving translation quality

container-title: **"Google’s Neural Machine Translation System: Bridging the Gap between Human and Machine Translation"** - Yonghui Wu et al

title: Describes Google's transition to neural machine translation and its impact
**"Attention Is All You Need"** - Ashish Vaswani et al
Introduces the Transformer model, which has become the backbone of modern translation systems

container-title: **"Massively Multilingual Neural Machine Translation in the Wild: Findings and Challenges"** - Melvin Johnson et al

title: Explores the challenges and solutions in building multilingual translation systems
**"Simultaneous Translation with Anticipation and Controllable Latency using Prefix-to-Prefix Framework"**
Discusses methods for reducing latency in simultaneous translation
**"Real Time Translation without a Phrase Table"** - William Lewis et al
Early work on real-time translation without relying on traditional phrase tables
**"End-to-End Speech Translation with Transducer"** - Ye Jia et al
Explores end-to-end models for direct speech-to-text translation
**"Direct Speech-to-Text Translation with a Sequence-to-Sequence Model"**
Discusses direct translation from speech to text using sequence-to-sequence models
**"Simultaneous Translation with Flexible Policy via Restricted Imitation Learning"** - Jiatao Gu et al
Introduces a flexible policy for simultaneous translation using imitation learning
**"Speech Translation and the End-to-End Promise: Taking Stock of Where We Are"**
A review of the state of end-to-end speech translation systems
**"A Survey of Simultaneous Machine Translation"**
Provides a comprehensive overview of simultaneous machine translation research
**"Simultaneous Neural Machine Translation using Operation Sequence Model"** - Xutai Ma et al
Proposes a model for simultaneous translation with improved efficiency
**"Learning to Wait: Adaptive Simultaneous Machine Translation"** - M
Discusses adaptive strategies for balancing translation quality and latency
**"Multilingual End-to-End Speech Translation"** - Juan Pino et al
Explores multilingual capabilities in end-to-end speech translation systems
**"Simultaneous Translation with Delayed Reinforcement Learning"** - Baigong Zheng et al
Introduces reinforcement learning techniques for improving simultaneous translation
**"Speech-to-Text Translation with Transformer"** - Ankur Bapna et al
Discusses the application of Transformer models to speech-to-text translation
**"Simultaneous Translation Policies: From Fixed to Adaptive"** - M
Explores the evolution of translation policies from fixed to adaptive systems
**"End-to-End Simultaneous Speech Translation with Convolutional Neural Networks"** - Jan Niehues et al
Investigates the use of CNNs for simultaneous speech translation
**"Towards Simultaneous Translation with Neural Models"**
Early exploration of neural models for simultaneous translation
These articles provide a broad overview of the field, covering both theoretical advancements and practical implementations in automatic simultaneous translation
